column4: Statoil makes small gas discovery off Norway
column5: OSLO  Feb 25 Statoil has made a small gas discovery in the North Sea  with reserves seen at between one million and two million standard cubic metres  the Norwegian Petroleum Directorate said on Thursday.

column4: Sturm Ruger sees more gun demand if Democrat is next president
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Sturm Ruger & Co  expects a lift in demand for its firearms if a Democrat wins this year's presidential election and becomes positioned to appoint future Supreme Court Justices  the company's CEO said on Thursday.

column4: Sturm Ruger sees more gun demand if Democrat is next president
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Sturm Ruger & Co  expects a lift in demand for its firearms if a Democrat wins this year's presidential election and becomes positioned to appoint future Supreme Court Justices  the company's CEO said on Thursday.

column4: Sturm Ruger sees more gun demand if Democrat is next president
UPDATE 2-Brazil telecom Oi sinks as LetterOne drops M&A funding plan
column5: SAO PAULO/MOSCOW  Feb 25 Shares and bonds of Oi SA  Brazil's most indebted telephone operator  tumbled on Thursday after Russian billionaire Mikhail Fridman's investment firm dropped an offer to finance the takeover of a Brazilian rival.

column4: Telefonica Brasil sees cost savings on track despite downturn
column5: SAO PAULO  Feb 25 Telefonica Brasil SA's  cost savings from the acquisition of broadband provider GVT are on track despite an ongoing economic recession  Chief Executive Amos Genish told analysts on an earnings call on Thursday.    (Reporting by Brad Haynes; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)

column4: Ternium not considering selling Usiminas stake -CEO
column5: BRASILIA  Feb 24 Ternium SA is not considering at this moment selling its stake in Brazilian steelmaker Usiminas  the company's chief executive officer  Daniel Novegil  said on Wednesday.

column4: RPT-LetterOne says cannot proceed with proposed Oi/Tim tie-up
column5: MOSCOW  Feb 25 London-based investment firm LetterOne  controlled by Russian billionaire Mikhail Fridman  said it could not proceed with its plan to facilitate a proposed merger between Brazilian telecoms groups Oi SA and TIM Participações SA.

column4: Google  Facebook  others plan briefs supporting Apple in iPhone case: sources
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Alphabet Inc's  Google  Facebook Inc   Microsoft Corp  and Twitter Inc  will all file or sign on to amicus briefs in support of Apple Inc's  fight against a magistrate's order  which requires it to help the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation break into a San Bernardino shooter's iPhone.

column4: Google  Facebook  others plan briefs supporting Apple in iPhone case-sources
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Feb 25 Alphabet Inc's  Google  Facebook Inc  Microsoft Corp and Twitter Inc will all file or sign on to amicus briefs in support of Apple Inc's fight against a magistrate's order  which requires it to help the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation break into a San Bernardino shooter's iPhone.

column4: Valeant board debating Pearson's return as health improves: CNBC
column5: The health of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc's  Michael Pearson is improving  the company said on Thursday  but CNBC reported that there was debate within the board over whether he was ready to return to work.

column4: Valeant board debating Pearson's return as health improves-CNBC
column5: Feb 25 The health of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc's Michael Pearson is improving  the company said on Thursday  but CNBC reported that there was debate within the board over whether he was ready to return to work.

column4: Verizon supports 'strong encryption with no backdoors': CEO
column5: NEW YORK Verizon Communications Inc supports "the availability of strong encryption with no backdoors " Chief Executive Lowell McAdam said on Wednesday  weighing in the showdown between Apple Inc and U.S. authorities over mobile device encryption.

column4: Verizon supports 'strong encryption with no backdoors': CEO
column5: NEW YORK Verizon Communications Inc supports "the availability of strong encryption with no backdoors " Chief Executive Lowell McAdam said on Wednesday  weighing in the showdown between Apple Inc and U.S. authorities over mobile device encryption.

column4: Visa signs MoU with China UnionPay
column5: China UnionPay and Visa Inc signed a memorandum of understanding to collaborate on payments security  Visa said on Thursday.

column4: Visa signs MoU with China UnionPay
column5: Feb 25 China UnionPay and Visa Inc signed a memorandum of understanding to collaborate on payments security  Visa said on Thursday.

column4: Ponies and princesses: Hasbro launches charm offensive for girls
column5: Feb 25 Having captivated boys with its Star Wars figures  Hasbro Inc is turning to Disney Princesses and the launch of its first animated movie to arrest a five-quarter slump in sales of its toys for girls.

column4: CORRECTED-Weight Watchers sales drop 21 percent
column5: Feb 25 Weight Watchers International Inc  reported a 21 percent decline in fourth-quarter sales as subscriptions fell.

column4: Whiting Petroleum's cuts present dilemma for investors
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 25 Shares of Whiting Petroleum Corp slumped on Thursday  extending their year-to-date losses  a day after the company said it would suspend all fracking and slash spending.

column4: Southwestern gets lower pipeline  gathering rates with Williams
column5: HOUSTON  Feb 25 Southwestern Energy Co  said on Thursday it and Williams Companies Inc have negotiated lower rates to gather  transport and process natural gas it produces in West Virginia in exchange for some new business for the pipeline operator.

column4: Williams Cos shares drop after NY Times report on deal problems
column5: NEW YORK Shares of Williams Companies  fell sharply in afternoon trading on Thursday following a New York Times report that Energy Transfer may be searching for a way to pull out of its deal with the company.

column4: CERAWEEK-Cheniere to export 8 to 10 additional LNG cargoes in coming months
column5: HOUSTON  Feb 25 Cheniere Energy expects to export eight to 10 more cargoes of liquefied natural gas (LNG) in the next two months out of its newly commissioned Sabine Pass terminal on the Texas-Louisiana border  a company executive told Reuters on Thursday.

column4: U.S. exports first shale gas as LNG tanker sails from Sabine Pass terminal
column5: SINGAPORE The United States has exported its first liquefied natural gas (LNG) cargo from the lower 48 states  after a tanker set sail from Cheniere Energy's Sabine Pass export terminal in Louisiana.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. exports first shale gas as LNG tanker sails from Sabine Pass terminal
column5: SINGAPORE  Feb 25 The United States has exported its first liquefied natural gas (LNG) cargo from the lower 48 states  after a tanker set sail from Cheniere Energy's  Sabine Pass export terminal in Louisiana.
